text.p: These are the leading stories in the Kenyan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Iranian President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani wants Kenya to press for the survival of the non-aligned movement and the democratic restructuring of the United Nations.

- Opposition FORD-Asili party parliament member John Mutere is elected chairman of the powerful parliamentary Public Investments Committee (PIC), taking over from political economics professor Peter Anyang' Nyong'o.
- Kenyan President Daniel arap Moi marks 72nd birthday with simple but joyous ceremony at State House, the presidency in the capital Nairobi.
- Information and Broadcasting Minister Johnstone Makau launches scathing attack on proponents of constitutional reform and says media waves are already liberalised.
- Nairobi City Mayor Dick Waweru survives a showdown with his predecessor John King'ori after a three-minute full council meeting confirms him in the mayoral job.
- Four people killed, one killed in ethnic violence in northern Kenya.
